2017-09-29.abstract: A public option could put competitive pressure on private health insurers. Markets in India and Mexico show how that might work in the United States.
2017-09-29.snippet: A public option could put competitive pressure on private health insurers. Markets in India and Mexico show how that might work in the United States.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: It is anyone’s guess whether Democrats will unite around the goal of creating a single-payer health care system or even take a less ambitious approach — introducing a public health insurance option.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Why Public Health Insurance Could Help, Even if You Don’t Want It

2017-09-29.abstract: Carmen Yulín Cruz, the mayor, had a blistering response to comments by an administration official about the situation in Puerto Rico.
2017-09-29.snippet: Carmen Yulín Cruz, the mayor, had a blistering response to comments by an administration official about the situation in Puerto Rico.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: A White House official’s praise of the government response to Hurricane Maria drew a sharp rebuke from the mayor of San Juan, as Puerto Ricans grew desperate in the aftermath of the storm, struggling to obtain basic life-sustaining supplies.
2017-09-29.headline_main: San Juan Mayor on Hurricane Response: ‘This Is Not a Good News Story’

2017-09-29.abstract: Two figure skaters at a competition in Germany earned places for the Games in South Korea, calming fears North Korea might interrupt the event.
2017-09-29.snippet: Two figure skaters at a competition in Germany earned places for the Games in South Korea, calming fears North Korea might interrupt the event.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: OBERSTDORF, Germany — The North Korean coach stood just off the ice and exhorted her figure skaters: “Keep going! Keep going!”
2017-09-29.headline_main: North Korean Figure Skaters Qualify for Olympics, Possibly Easing Tensions

2017-09-29.abstract: Nine years ago, Hannah Upp disappeared in New York and was found weeks later in a fugue state. Now she is missing in the hurricane-devastated Virgin Islands.
2017-09-29.snippet: Nine years ago, Hannah Upp disappeared in New York and was found weeks later in a fugue state. Now she is missing in the hurricane-devastated Virgin Islands.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: On Sept. 14, one week after Hurricane Irma swept through the Caribbean, a 32-year-old teacher named Hannah Upp left her apartment on St. Thomas, in the Virgin Islands, to go for a morning swim at a nearby beach. According to a note she left for her friends, she then planned to go to the Virgin Islands Montessori School, where she worked as a teacher. It seemed as if she’d be home before the curfew the government had imposed in the wake of the storm.
2017-09-29.headline_main: A Teacher Vanishes Again. This Time, in the Virgin Islands.

2017-09-29.abstract: The Staten Island district attorney convicted a man of murder 23 years ago. A lawyer who has investigated the case for five years says he wasn’t the killer.
2017-09-29.snippet: The Staten Island district attorney convicted a man of murder 23 years ago. A lawyer who has investigated the case for five years says he wasn’t the killer.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: In the rainy early morning of July 4, 1992, two armed men pushed their way into a drug stash house in a third-floor apartment of a Staten Island housing project, not far from the ferry terminal. It was a robbery: hardly the first in the crime-ridden neighborhood of New Brighton in those crime-ridden times.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Two Confessions and Claims of Misconduct in Murder Case

2017-09-29.abstract: Even more than other parents, the elderly struggle to recover from the death of a child.
2017-09-29.snippet: Even more than other parents, the elderly struggle to recover from the death of a child.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Anne McBrearty Giotta doesn’t remember much of what happened on that August morning in 2013.
2017-09-29.headline_main: A Child’s Death Brings ‘Trauma That Doesn’t Go Away’

2017-09-29.abstract: Every month, Netflix Canada adds a new batch of movies and TV shows to its library. Here’s what we like for October.
2017-09-29.snippet: Every month, Netflix Canada adds a new batch of movies and TV shows to its library. Here’s what we like for October.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Watching, The New York Times’s TV and movie recommendation site.
2017-09-29.headline_main: The Best Movies and TV Shows New on Netflix Canada in October

2017-09-29.abstract: Our reporter was left agitated, delirious and maybe even enlightened by a marathon performance of Satie’s “Vexations” at the Guggenheim Museum.
2017-09-29.snippet: Our reporter was left agitated, delirious and maybe even enlightened by a marathon performance of Satie’s “Vexations” at the Guggenheim Museum.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: The hallucinations began around 4 a.m. — nine hours and not even halfway through Erik Satie’s “Vexations,” the devilishly beguiling piece that, depending on whom you ask, is either a step toward Zen enlightenment or the longest joke in music history.
2017-09-29.headline_main: What It’s Like to Hear the Same Piece of Music for 19 Hours

2017-09-29.abstract: Ten years ago, a Jamaican modeling industry barely existed. Then fashion got the diversity memo, and now island talent is blossoming everywhere.
2017-09-29.snippet: Ten years ago, a Jamaican modeling industry barely existed. Then fashion got the diversity memo, and now island talent is blossoming everywhere.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: PORT ANTONIO, Jamaica — His machete blade a blur, Tevin Steele whacks the top off a fresh green coconut. Deftly knifing a window through the tender pith, he inserts a straw and hands the fruit across the counter at Dinga-Fling, his roadside stall outside this drowsy coastal town. Selling coconuts is his livelihood, and Mr. Steele, 21, says it is a good one, though neither as promising, lucrative or downright implausible as his other.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Jamaica Puts a Different Face on the Runways

2017-09-29.abstract: One small step for a columnist, one, er, small step for mankind.
2017-09-29.snippet: One small step for a columnist, one, er, small step for mankind.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: For issue portfolio reasons, my column in the physical paper will move from Monday-Friday to Tuesday-Friday, effective immediately. Which means that I have Sundays again! I don’t expect any changes in content, although more chance to respond to start-of-the-week disasters news.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Ch-ch-ch-ch-changes (In Column Days)

2017-09-29.abstract: After years of autonomy in Iraq, Kurds overwhelmingly supported a referendum on independence, creating another destabilizing crisis in the Middle East.
2017-09-29.snippet: After years of autonomy in Iraq, Kurds overwhelmingly supported a referendum on independence, creating another destabilizing crisis in the Middle East.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Several million Kurds in Iraq have taken a symbolic step toward achieving a dream deferred since the end of World War I: establishing a homeland of their own.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Kurds Voted for Independence. Here’s Who Else Has a Say.

2017-09-29.abstract: The director pieced together his masterpiece “Othello” over several years and continents, and then revisited it two decades later in a documentary about its making.
2017-09-29.snippet: The director pieced together his masterpiece “Othello” over several years and continents, and then revisited it two decades later in a documentary about its making.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Something odder than a masterpiece, Orson Welles’s “Othello” is at once a credible abridgment of Shakespeare and a jigsaw puzzle that nearly defies comprehension.
2017-09-29.headline_main: ‘Othello’: Shakespeare’s Tragedy Was Orson Welles’s Triumph

2017-09-29.abstract: Robert Gottlieb talks about new romance novels, and Celeste Ng discusses her new novel, “Little Fires Everywhere.”
2017-09-29.snippet: Robert Gottlieb talks about new romance novels, and Celeste Ng discusses her new novel, “Little Fires Everywhere.”
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music
2017-09-29.headline_main: Recent Romances

2017-09-29.abstract: “Between the World and Me,” Coates’s treatise on black male life in America, catapulted him to prominence. Coates spoke to The Times about his new book, “We Were Eight Years in Power,” his year in Paris and what he’s up to next.
2017-09-29.snippet: “Between the World and Me,” Coates’s treatise on black male life in America, catapulted him to prominence. Coates spoke to The Times about his new book, “We Were Eight Years in Power,” his year in Paris and what he’s up to next.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: When Ta-Nehisi Coates’s first book, “The Beautiful Struggle,” was published in 2008, it landed with barely a ripple. At the time, Mr. Coates was a struggling writer. He had lost three jobs, and he and his family relied on unemployment checks, his wife’s income and occasional support from his father to stay afloat. By the time the book came out in paperback, his fortune had shifted slightly; he’d become a regular contributor to The Atlantic magazine, writing a blog that attracted a moderate but engaged audience.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Ta-Nehisi Coates and the Making of a Public Intellectual

2017-09-29.abstract: TunesMap, which offers a feed of videos, photographs and links to related material when songs are streamed, will make its debut as an Apple TV app in November.
2017-09-29.snippet: TunesMap, which offers a feed of videos, photographs and links to related material when songs are streamed, will make its debut as an Apple TV app in November.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Two decades into the era of online music, streaming has been hailed as the industry’s savior, but a complaint from the earliest days of digital services persists: What happened to the liner notes?
2017-09-29.headline_main: Restoring Those Old Liner Notes in Music’s Digital Era

2017-09-29.abstract: What keeps the tax-cut zombie alive?
2017-09-29.snippet: What keeps the tax-cut zombie alive?
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Who rules the American right? I fairly often find myself talking with people who see either the nation as a whole or at least the right side of the political spectrum as a pure oligarchy, where the big money controls everything. And money definitely plays an outsized and generally malign role in policy. Usually, however, it’s only the root of some evil, not all evil: the vileness of a Roy Moore or Joe Arpaio comes from very different sources,
2017-09-29.headline_main: Unpopular Delusions and the Madness of Elites

2017-09-29.abstract: Our weekly look for and about Canadians reviews the latest trade tussle between Canada and the United States and previews a Broadway show with Canadian input.
2017-09-29.snippet: Our weekly look for and about Canadians reviews the latest trade tussle between Canada and the United States and previews a Broadway show with Canadian input.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: This week the roadshow to renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement made its way to Ottawa. Although the city was suffering through an exceptional September heat wave, the Canadian government offered school buses that lacked air conditioning to shuttle government officials and reporters to and from the site hosting the talks.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Canada Letter: The Land Where Trade Talks Make Headlines

2017-09-29.abstract: I was fighting for women’s liberation. The Playboy creator only pretended to.
2017-09-29.snippet: I was fighting for women’s liberation. The Playboy creator only pretended to.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: On March 26, 1970, I accepted an invitation to appear on “The Dick Cavett Show” to talk about a new movement I was involved with called Women’s Liberation. I knew that our young movement was suspicious of activists who sought media attention, so I roped my friend Sally Kempton, a talented writer, into coming with me. I don’t recall if we knew ahead of time who the principal guest that evening would be. He turned out to be Hugh Hefner.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Hugh Hefner Was My Enemy

2017-09-29.abstract: A chocolate chip cookie, thin with crisp ripples that run to the edges, finds Instagram fame.
2017-09-29.snippet: A chocolate chip cookie, thin with crisp ripples that run to the edges, finds Instagram fame.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Last fall, an aberrant chocolate chip cookie turned up in my Instagram feed. As wide as a salad plate and flat as a flounder, it appeared thin, but it was somehow layered with slabs of chocolate. Oddest of all, it was ringed, like a tree trunk — as if a chunk of chocolate had been dropped in the center and somehow made waves out to the edges. I assumed it was a mutant, posted by a troubled baker as a cry for help, and I kept scrolling.
2017-09-29.headline_main: An Internet-Famous Cookie Worthy of Baking in Real Life

2017-09-29.abstract: Speaking to the National Association of Manufacturers, the president said that under his leadership “the era of economic surrender is over.”
2017-09-29.snippet: Speaking to the National Association of Manufacturers, the president said that under his leadership “the era of economic surrender is over.”
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump took his push for deep tax cuts to a supportive audience of manufacturers on Friday, arguing that reducing levies on businesses will be “rocket fuel” to propel economic growth and ultimately translate to more jobs and better wages for American workers, as well.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Trump Pitches Tax Cuts as ‘Rocket Fuel’ for the Economy

2017-09-29.abstract: At an exhibit at the Franklin Institute, visitors will be able to use an app on their phones to see digital images of spears and arrows for the statues.
2017-09-29.snippet: At an exhibit at the Franklin Institute, visitors will be able to use an app on their phones to see digital images of spears and arrows for the statues.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — Imagine pointing your phone at China’s ancient terracotta warriors to arm them with spears and bows, weapons that disintegrated long ago.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Arming China’s Terracotta Warriors — With Your Phone

2017-09-29.abstract: The new CBS show is the latest drama to suggest the answer to the world’s problems are wealthy and off-putting tech titans who have suddenly decided to care.
2017-09-29.snippet: The new CBS show is the latest drama to suggest the answer to the world’s problems are wealthy and off-putting tech titans who have suddenly decided to care.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: If you follow the tech business, you may have heard the formulation, “It’s Uber, but for ...” The idea is that there’s no human endeavor that can’t be transformed by a little coding, as Uber did for taxis. Uber, but for pizza. Uber, but for classical music. Uber, but for marijuana.
2017-09-29.headline_main: ‘Wisdom of the Crowd’ is the Latest in the ‘Yay, Rich Jerks’ Genre

2017-09-29.snippet: The label shows its spring looks.

2017-09-29.abstract: The release of the Senate’s budget resolution is a critical step toward passing a tax overhaul that is protected from a Democratic filibuster.
2017-09-29.snippet: The release of the Senate’s budget resolution is a critical step toward passing a tax overhaul that is protected from a Democratic filibuster.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate Budget Committee unveiled a 2018 budget blueprint on Friday that would open the door for a $1.5 trillion tax cut, even as an independent analysis concluded that the plan as offered would far exceed that price tag and overwhelmingly benefit corporations and the rich.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Senate Unveils Budget Blueprint Allowing $1.5 Trillion in Tax Cuts

2017-09-29.abstract: Join us on Thursday, Oct. 19, for a discussion with Betsy Fisher, Theresa Watts, Hilton Hollis and Helene Cooper.
2017-09-29.snippet: Join us on Thursday, Oct. 19, for a discussion with Betsy Fisher, Theresa Watts, Hilton Hollis and Helene Cooper.

2017-09-29.abstract: Listen to the songs that caught our critics' attention this week, from a track Chance the Rapper debuted on "Colbert" to the finale of Torres' new album.
2017-09-29.snippet: Listen to the songs that caught our critics' attention this week, from a track Chance the Rapper debuted on "Colbert" to the finale of Torres' new album.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the week’s most notable new songs and videos — and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. This week, Chance the Rapper debuts a song on “Colbert,” Torres ends her new album with transcendence and Yeah Yeah Yeahs dig up a track from the “Fever to Tell” era.
2017-09-29.headline_main: The Playlist: Hear Beyoncé Join ‘Mi Gente,’ Plus 9 More New Songs

2017-09-29.abstract: In the book, Moses Farrow asserts that Ms. Farrow coached her daughter, Dylan Farrow, in accusing Mr. Allen of sexual abuse.
2017-09-29.snippet: In the book, Moses Farrow asserts that Ms. Farrow coached her daughter, Dylan Farrow, in accusing Mr. Allen of sexual abuse.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: A new book about Woody Allen’s film career includes allegations that Mia Farrow, his former partner, was abusive toward their children and coached their daughter, Dylan, to accuse Mr. Allen of sexual abuse. An excerpt from the book, which will be published Tuesday, was provided by its publisher, Knopf.
2017-09-29.headline_main: New Book About Woody Allen Alleges Abusive Parenting by Mia Farrow

2017-09-29.abstract: An outpouring of relief efforts in New York after Hurricane Maria reflects a bond to the island that has stretched over decades.
2017-09-29.snippet: An outpouring of relief efforts in New York after Hurricane Maria reflects a bond to the island that has stretched over decades.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Alejandro Torres had no hope of boarding a flight out of Puerto Rico, or even talking to an airline employee in person. Still, he returned to the airport in San Juan, as sweltering and packed as it was: The terminal there was one of the few places his cellphone could pick up a signal, connecting him to the life he needed to get back to in New York City.
2017-09-29.headline_main: New York’s Response to Puerto Rico Devastation: ‘It’s Personal for Us’

2017-09-29.abstract: Lawyers say those most affected by pay bias deserve to know why the Trump administration is siding with companies.
2017-09-29.snippet: Lawyers say those most affected by pay bias deserve to know why the Trump administration is siding with companies.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-09-29.headline_main: Trump and the Racial Pay Gap

2017-09-29.abstract: The president and chief executive of Marriott defended the decision, saying that the hotel should not decide whose views are acceptable.
2017-09-29.snippet: The president and chief executive of Marriott defended the decision, saying that the hotel should not decide whose views are acceptable.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: ACT for America, a group that the Southern Poverty Law Center says is anti-Muslim, and the Council on American-Islamic Relations, whose mission is to enhance the understanding of Islam, have at least one thing in common: they’re each holding an event at the same Marriott hotel in Arlington, Va., just a few weeks apart.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Marriott Won’t Cancel Event by Group Criticized as Anti-Muslim

2017-09-29.abstract: North Korea says it would be foolish for the United States to expect it to abandon its nuclear weapons, despite the harm of sanctions.
2017-09-29.snippet: North Korea says it would be foolish for the United States to expect it to abandon its nuclear weapons, despite the harm of sanctions.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea said on Friday that American-led international sanctions were causing “colossal” damage in the impoverished country, but added that it would be foolish for Washington to think the sanctions would stop the country’s nuclear weapons programs.
2017-09-29.headline_main: North Korea Says U.N. Sanctions Are Causing ‘Colossal’ Damage

2017-09-29.abstract: The first detailed assessment of the tax plan found that the average tax bill would fall by $1,600, or 2.1 percent, in 2018. But the biggest drop would go to those with incomes above $730,000.
2017-09-29.snippet: The first detailed assessment of the tax plan found that the average tax bill would fall by $1,600, or 2.1 percent, in 2018. But the biggest drop would go to those with incomes above $730,000.

2017-09-29.abstract: A drawing at the Condé Museum, similar in composition to that of the Louvre’s painting, has long been attributed to the master’s studio.
2017-09-29.snippet: A drawing at the Condé Museum, similar in composition to that of the Louvre’s painting, has long been attributed to the master’s studio.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Behind closed doors in the Louvre’s basements, experts have been scrutinizing a drawing for weeks with one question on their minds: Could this semi-naked, mysteriously smiling lady that looks strikingly like the Mona Lisa be a sketch by Leonardo da Vinci?
2017-09-29.headline_main: Did Leonardo da Vinci Sketch the ‘Nude Mona Lisa’?

2017-09-29.abstract: The original starred Julia Roberts, Kiefer Sutherland and Kevin Bacon, among others. The new one has Ellen Page and some horror movie tricks.
2017-09-29.snippet: The original starred Julia Roberts, Kiefer Sutherland and Kevin Bacon, among others. The new one has Ellen Page and some horror movie tricks.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Remakes — especially of beloved classics — run the risk of alienating sentimental moviegoers. With “Flatliners,” Columbia Pictures takes a bold, innovative step to address this issue.

2017-09-29.abstract: A judge on Thursday dismissed a police officer’s lawsuit against Black Lives Matter, saying that he cannot sue a social movement.
2017-09-29.snippet: A judge on Thursday dismissed a police officer’s lawsuit against Black Lives Matter, saying that he cannot sue a social movement.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: A judge in Louisiana on Thursday said that Black Lives Matter is a social movement and therefore can’t be sued, dismissing a lawsuit brought by an anonymous police officer.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Black Lives Matter Can’t Be Sued, Judge Tells Police Officer

2017-09-29.abstract: Instead of going down with the plane, the recorders will be released and bob back to the surface. They will then send a signal to satellites.

2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Ever since Isabel Marant backed into men’s wear in 2013, designing a few men’s piece for her H&M collaboration, her fans have been asking for more. “I’m inundated by guys asking me, ‘When are you going to do men’s?’” Ms. Marant said before her show in the Palais Royal on Thursday night.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Isabel Marant Wants to Dress You and Your Boyfriend

2017-09-29.abstract: If everyone is upset with you, as the platform’s chief says, are you really doing something right?
2017-09-29.snippet: If everyone is upset with you, as the platform’s chief says, are you really doing something right?
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Responding to President Trump’s tweet this week that “Facebook was always anti-Trump,” Mark Zuckerberg, the chief executive of Facebook, defended the company by noting that Mr. Trump’s opponents also criticize it — as having aided Mr. Trump. If everyone is upset with you, Mr. Zuckerberg suggested, you must be doing something right.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Zuckerberg’s Preposterous Defense of Facebook

2017-09-29.abstract: Four premieres (and four sets of new couture costumes) showcased youthfulness and a liberal view of life and dance.
2017-09-29.snippet: Four premieres (and four sets of new couture costumes) showcased youthfulness and a liberal view of life and dance.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, New York City Ballet’s fall gala became an event for fashion onstage: an annual rendezvous in which new choreography joined new couture. Since 2014, the formula has been four creations, made by four different choreographers, each with a design team from the fashion world.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Review: The Unstuffy Gala: City Ballet Delivers Youth and Style

2017-09-29.abstract: Schools on Long Island and in Louisiana have cautioned students against protesting. And in public schools, such directives run up against students’ First Amendment rights.
2017-09-29.snippet: Schools on Long Island and in Louisiana have cautioned students against protesting. And in public schools, such directives run up against students’ First Amendment rights.

2017-09-29.headline_main: High Schools Threaten to Punish Students Who Kneel During Anthem

2017-09-29.abstract: There are many reasons he doesn’t think the rules apply. The Garden State is one of them.
2017-09-29.snippet: There are many reasons he doesn’t think the rules apply. The Garden State is one of them.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Jared Kushner, first son-in-law and White House senior adviser, used a personal email account to communicate about government business, it was recently revealed. In his initial application for a security clearance, Mr. Kushner failed to list a single meeting with a foreign government official during the campaign and transition. (Amended forms now reportedly list over a hundred contacts.) He is also, according to official sources, a person of interest in the investigation into the Trump campaign’s dealings with Russia, although when he was recently hauled up to Capitol Hill to testify about a meeting he attended at Trump Tower in June 2016 with a Kremlin-linked lawyer who was promising dirt on Hillary Clinton, he insisted he was entirely blameless.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Jared Kushner’s Entitlement Is New Jersey Born and Bred

2017-09-29.abstract: A chance encounter with a falling tree let scientists finally confirm the existence of a legendary rodent species in the South Pacific.
2017-09-29.snippet: A chance encounter with a falling tree let scientists finally confirm the existence of a legendary rodent species in the South Pacific.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Locals living on the island of Vangunu in the Solomon Islands sing songs about vika, a giant, tree-dwelling rat that can crack open coconuts with its teeth. But scientists had never seen it.
2017-09-29.headline_main: The Elusive Giant Coconut-Cracking Rat of the Solomon Islands

2017-09-29.abstract: Collectors who want their life’s work to live on after they die sometimes do this, but like many things, there is more to it than meets the eye.
2017-09-29.snippet: Collectors who want their life’s work to live on after they die sometimes do this, but like many things, there is more to it than meets the eye.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Paintings, sculptures, gems, cars, items made perfectly by a single craftsman — if you have the collector’s gene, these are the kinds of things you must own. Add wealth to fuel that desire, and your collection is likely to grow. But then what do you do with it?
2017-09-29.headline_main: A Collector’s Dream: Creating Your Own Museum as a Legacy

2017-09-29.abstract: The pitcher retired the first 14 batters he faced to keep the playoff-bound Yankees mathematically alive for the A.L. East title.
2017-09-29.snippet: The pitcher retired the first 14 batters he faced to keep the playoff-bound Yankees mathematically alive for the A.L. East title.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ 4-0 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays on Friday performed the function of keeping their faint American League East title hopes alive, at least for another day.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Masahiro Tanaka Strikes Out 15 on an Unusual Day for the Yankees

2017-09-29.abstract: The creepy sci-fi drama, based on a best-selling novel, is from Alex Garland, the director of “Ex Machina.”
2017-09-29.snippet: The creepy sci-fi drama, based on a best-selling novel, is from Alex Garland, the director of “Ex Machina.”
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Alex Garland follows up his 2015 directorial debut, “Ex Machina,” with another creepy sci-fi drama featuring Oscar Isaac. Only in “Annihilation,” Mr. Isaac’s character vanishes early on, during a mission into an environmental danger zone, and his wife, played by Natalie Portman, leads an expedition to save him.
2017-09-29.headline_main: New Trailer: ‘Annihilation’ Puts Natalie Portman in Danger

2017-09-29.abstract: Conservatives who hate judicial activism should be alarmed by Roy Moore, the Republican Senate nominee in Alabama. But many love his kind of activism.
2017-09-29.snippet: Conservatives who hate judicial activism should be alarmed by Roy Moore, the Republican Senate nominee in Alabama. But many love his kind of activism.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: For some time now conservative Republicans have been screaming about activist judges who put their own political opinions above the law. And they’ve been right to complain. But now, thanks to socially conservative voters in Alabama, we learn that they didn’t really mean it. What bothered them weren’t activist judges in general — but liberal activist judges in particular. Conservative activism by a judge who gets his marching orders from the Bible is apparently fine.
2017-09-29.headline_main: The Activist Judge Conservatives Love

2017-09-29.abstract: The in-demand Chinese designer brings her fantastical high-fashion to the Peach State.
2017-09-29.snippet: The in-demand Chinese designer brings her fantastical high-fashion to the Peach State.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: When the designer Guo Pei turned 100 days old, her family dressed her in a special outfit made from one of her grandmother’s old silk qipaos in accordance with Chinese tradition. Guo was born during the Cultural Revolution, when citizens were forced to give up all traces of finery and individuality. Girls didn’t wear dresses, clothing was devoid of color and silk was something that Guo rarely saw in her younger years. Her baby outfit was the first beautiful garment that she remembers.
2017-09-29.headline_main: In Atlanta With Guo Pei, Who Spins Stories in Couture

2017-09-29.abstract: The Directors Guild of America says that the pool of new directors is growing more diverse, but some industry officials are not so sure.

2017-09-29.abstract: The health and human services secretary stepped down soon after President Trump said that he was “not happy” about Mr. Price’s travel bills.

2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Tom Price, the health and human services secretary, resigned under pressure on Friday after racking up at least $400,000 in travel bills for chartered flights and undermining President Trump’s promise to drain the swamp of a corrupt and entitled capital.

2017-09-29.snippet: The department says the conflict-of-interest statute, passed after scandals in for-profit education, is outdated, but others call it a safeguard.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: The Department of Veterans Affairs is pushing to suspend a 50-year-old ethics law that prevents employees from receiving money or owning a stake in for-profit colleges that pocket hundreds of millions of dollars in tuition paid through the G.I. Bill of Rights.

2017-09-29.abstract: The actor has set off Oscar talk with his portrayal of the British leader in the film due in November.
2017-09-29.snippet: The actor has set off Oscar talk with his portrayal of the British leader in the film due in November.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: When it comes to playing Winston Churchill, actors will never, never, never give up. John Lithgow recently won an Emmy as the British bulldog in Netflix’s “The Crown,” and Brian Cox embodied the title role in this year’s biopic “Churchill.” Now Gary Oldman throws his homburg into the ring with “Darkest Hour,” and it’s already earning him best actor Oscar talk.
2017-09-29.headline_main: New Trailer: Gary Oldman Takes on Churchill in ‘Darkest Hour’

2017-09-29.abstract: Decades of economic progress were undone in 12 hours by Hurricane Maria. Now the island needs substantial and sustained help.
2017-09-29.snippet: Decades of economic progress were undone in 12 hours by Hurricane Maria. Now the island needs substantial and sustained help.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: Almost nothing on the planet, short of nuclear weaponry, destroys economic value as rapidly as a mega-hurricane. In Puerto Rico, decades of economic progress were undone in 12 hours by Hurricane Maria.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Don’t Let Puerto Rico Fall Into an Economic Abyss

2017-09-29.abstract: In a country hungry for “authenticity,” activists have seized on the Tory lawmaker Jacob Rees-Mogg, whose upper-crust persona seems drawn from another era.

2017-09-29.abstract: Lord Lucan, the first peer indicted in a killing since 1760, disappeared after the 1974 slaying of his children’s nanny. Did he mistake her for his wife?
2017-09-29.snippet: Lord Lucan, the first peer indicted in a killing since 1760, disappeared after the 1974 slaying of his children’s nanny. Did he mistake her for his wife?
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: In November 1974, John Bingham, the seventh Earl of Lucan, a dashing but dissolute gambler, supposedly mistook his children’s nanny for his estranged wife in the dimly lit basement of their London home and bludgeoned her to death. Then he vanished, never to be seen again.
2017-09-29.headline_main: Lady Lucan, Last Witness to a Murder Most Lurid, Dies at 80

2017-09-29.abstract: The health and human services secretary sent dispatches from his globe-trotting to agency staff members, including many who faced budget-related travel restrictions.
2017-09-29.snippet: The health and human services secretary sent dispatches from his globe-trotting to agency staff members, including many who faced budget-related travel restrictions.
2017-09-29.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As he traversed the world on taxpayer-funded flights, Tom Price made it a habit to write home, repeatedly sending celebratory letters back to staff members at the Department of Health and Human Services detailing his time on the road, and complimenting agency employees who “ensure the good stewardship of taxpayer dollars.”
2017-09-29.headline_main: ‘Another Fantastic Week’: Tom Price’s Celebratory Travelogues

2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: As the dust settles on the 18-hour documentary “The Vietnam War,” it seems unlikely that the longstanding debates engendered by the conflict will abate much in the film’s aftermath. As is so often the case, most reviews, some written even before the first episode of Ken Burns and Lynn Novick’s epic aired, reveal more about the reviewer than the film itself. When it comes to the war in Vietnam, there are plenty of hobbyhorses to mount.

2017-09-30.abstract: A visit with Dan Brown, whose new novel — as with all of his works — doesn’t shy away from the big questions, but rushes pell-mell into them. In “Origin,” the question is: Can science make religion obsolete?
2017-09-30.snippet: A visit with Dan Brown, whose new novel — as with all of his works — doesn’t shy away from the big questions, but rushes pell-mell into them. In “Origin,” the question is: Can science make religion obsolete?
2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: RYE BEACH, N.H. — Anyone who has read Dan Brown’s work — and with 200 million copies of his books in print, you know who you are — is familiar with his signature technique of inserting little chunks of expository information into the narrative. Among the topics addressed in his latest thriller, “Origin”: the wide-ranging talents of Winston Churchill, the elusive appeal of abstract art, the exciting peculiarities of Gaudi’s Sagrada Familia cathedral and the latest insane developments in the world of artificial intelligence.
2017-09-30.headline_main: The World According to Dan Brown

2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: Downstairs at the Beverly Hilton hotel on Feb. 11, 2012, black cars delivered celebrities, among them Serena Williams, Britney Spears and Gayle King, to Clive Davis’s annual Grammys party. Upstairs in Room 434, the coroner’s office tended to the body of his biggest star, Whitney Houston, who had been found dead in the bathtub earlier that day. Police investigators removed empty bottles of liquor while the wails of her daughter, Bobbi Kristina Brown, could be heard down the hall.

2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: Agnes Bourne, an interior designer based in Jackson, Wyo., always loved to visit her sister’s rustic dwelling near Spokane, Wash. The 1890s log house was on an astonishing site: next to a lake full of trout, deep within a thousand acres of unlogged forests of Douglas firs and Ponderosa pines. It was filled with open skies, eagles, ospreys, wildflowers and giant boulders, some marked with Native American petroglyphs.

2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: “I feel really connected to Moscow, but I also still feel a little bit like a tourist,” Sasha Arutyunova said. Ms. Arutyunova, who lives in Brooklyn, was born in Moscow in 1988, a few years before the Soviet Union collapsed and during an era when Levi’s were still a coveted item in the country. 2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: Amazon is often promoting the idea of improving the world. Therefore its second headquarters should do that. Knowing that it is a game changer, Amazon should go to a Rust Belt city and forever alter the economy of the region. Take a good look at Pittsburgh or Cleveland. Both have had a renaissance and offer lovely downtowns, beautiful architecture, great waterfronts, beautiful parks, treelined streets, excellent cultural amenities, great public transportation and pro sports teams. Even better, they have great colleges and medical facilities.
2017-09-30.headline_main: Dear Amazon: Please Build Here

Near the end of the Mass, the 86-year-old bishop nearly fainted. “I am so happy, I am so happy,” he whispered as he was led to a chair.

2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: A year ago my life went to hell. After I declared myself unable to support the election of Donald Trump because of my faith and conservative convictions, three protesters showed up on my front porch. They did not threaten physical harm. But they did express feelings of betrayal and declared their intention to ruin my career as a conservative talk radio host and writer. I needed to carefully reconsider, or else.

2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: My tenure as the Frugal Traveler columnist began inauspiciously. My first official frugal assignment, to Las Vegas, went smoothly enough. But during my second, to Hawaii, I blew out two tires driving on a remote, cell-service-free part of the island, had to be towed 140 miles back to the rental car desk, and was slapped with a $1,500 bill. On my third trip, my bus from Chicago to Milwaukee erupted into a ball of flames. “Someone doesn’t want you to have this job,” a friend suggested.
2017-09-30.headline_main: When Budget Vacations Are Your Job

2017-09-30.snippet: Kevin De Bruyne’s goal lifted City to a 1-0 victory, but the comprehensive nature of the visitors’ performance may have been even more important.
2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: LONDON — A few days before Manchester City met Chelsea for the first time last season — a game that, in hindsight, would mark out the latter as Premier League champions-in-waiting and the former as a work in progress — Pep Guardiola came to a realization.
2017-09-30.headline_main: For Manchester City, Slim Victory at Chelsea Speaks to a Wider Goal

2017-09-30.abstract: Robert Fisher’s glass is tremendously full, of something delicious.
2017-09-30.snippet: Robert Fisher’s glass is tremendously full, of something delicious.
2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — This is a dense puzzle, even for a Sunday, and puzzlers may note with trepidation that four of the six theme answers span or nearly span the entire grid, despite having the briefest of clues.
2017-09-30.headline_main: That’s One Way to Put It

2017-09-30.abstract: A proposal to the board by Uber’s new chief, Dara Khosrowshahi, and Goldman Sachs would reduce the voting clout of the ex-C.E.O., Travis Kalanick.
2017-09-30.snippet: A proposal to the board by Uber’s new chief, Dara Khosrowshahi, and Goldman Sachs would reduce the voting clout of the ex-C.E.O., Travis Kalanick.
2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The phone calls began late Friday among Uber’s new chief executive, Dara Khosrowshahi, and the ride-hailing company’s executives, as well as board members and a raft of lawyers. They were facing an emergency.
2017-09-30.headline_main: Inside the Latest Power Struggle at Uber

2017-09-30.abstract: On the island, the outspokenness of the liberal mayor, who tends to speak in blunt and emotional terms, has come as little surprise.
2017-09-30.snippet: On the island, the outspokenness of the liberal mayor, who tends to speak in blunt and emotional terms, has come as little surprise.
2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — When Carmen Yulín Cruz was a long-shot candidate for mayor here in 2012, she cast herself as a “pitirre,” a small bird known for fearlessly attacking larger ones.
2017-09-30.headline_main: Who Is Carmen Yulín Cruz, the Puerto Rican Mayor Criticized by Trump?

2017-09-30.abstract: Mickelson’s wife, Amy, and two of their children looked on as he took the record for the most career wins in the event and as the United States nearly finished off the International team.
2017-09-30.snippet: Mickelson’s wife, Amy, and two of their children looked on as he took the record for the most career wins in the event and as the United States nearly finished off the International team.
2017-09-30.lead_paragraph: JERSEY CITY — Spectators ringed the 17th green at Liberty National on Saturday, many of them yelling terms of endearment at Phil Mickelson. “Hoboken loves you, Phil,” one said. But Mickelson played his Presidents Cup foursomes match, a record breaker, primarily for an audience of three.
2017-09-30.headline_main: Phil Mickelson, With Family in Tow, Breaks a Presidents Cup Record
